segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 10. Loṇakapallavagga
segments.en: 10. A Lump of Salt

segments.pli: 92. Accāyikasutta
segments.en: 92. Urgent

segments.pli: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, kassakassa gahapatissa accāyikāni karaṇīyāni.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a farmer has three urgent duties.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, kassako gahapati sīghaṃ sīghaṃ khettaṃ sukaṭṭhaṃ karoti sumatikataṃ.
segments.en: A farmer swiftly makes sure the field is well ploughed and tilled.

segments.pli: Sīghaṃ sīghaṃ khettaṃ sukaṭṭhaṃ karitvā sumatikataṃ sīghaṃ sīghaṃ bījāni patiṭṭhāpeti.
segments.en: Next they swiftly plant seeds in season.

segments.pli: Sīghaṃ sīghaṃ bījāni patiṭṭhāpetvā sīghaṃ sīghaṃ udakaṃ abhinetipi apanetipi.
segments.en: When the time is right, they swiftly irrigate or drain the field.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi kassakassa gahapatissa accāyikāni karaṇīyāni.
segments.en: These are the three urgent duties of a farmer.

segments.pli: Tassa kho taṃ, bhikkhave, kassakassa gahapatissa natthi sā iddhi vā ānubhāvo vā:
segments.en: That farmer has no special power or ability to say:

segments.pli: ‘ajjeva me dhaññāni jāyantu, sveva gabbhīni hontu, uttarasveva paccantū’ti.
segments.en: ‘Let the crops germinate today! Let them flower tomorrow! Let them ripen the day after!’

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, hoti so samayo yaṃ tassa kassakassa gahapatissa tāni dhaññāni utupariṇāmīni jāyantipi gabbhīnipi honti paccantipi.
segments.en: But there comes a time when that farmer’s crops germinate, flower, and ripen as the seasons change.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tīṇimāni bhikkhussa accāyikāni karaṇīyāni.
segments.en: In the same way, a mendicant has three urgent duties.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Adhisīlasikkhāsamādānaṃ, adhicittasikkhāsamādānaṃ, adhipaññāsikkhāsamādānaṃ—
segments.en: Undertaking the training in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.

segments.pli: imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi bhikkhussa accāyikāni karaṇīyāni.
segments.en: These are the three urgent duties of a mendicant.

segments.pli: Tassa kho taṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno natthi sā iddhi vā ānubhāvo vā:
segments.en: That mendicant has no special power or ability to say:

segments.pli: ‘ajjeva me anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccatu sve vā uttarasve vā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Let my mind be freed from defilements by not grasping today! Or tomorrow! Or the day after!’

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, hoti so samayo yaṃ tassa bhikkhuno adhisīlampi sikkhato adhicittampi sikkhato adhipaññampi sikkhato anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccati.
segments.en: But there comes a time—as that mendicant trains in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom—that their mind is freed from defilements by not grasping.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘tibbo no chando bhavissati adhisīlasikkhāsamādāne, tibbo chando bhavissati adhicittasikkhāsamādāne, tibbo chando bhavissati adhipaññāsikkhāsamādāne’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will have keen enthusiasm for undertaking the training in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.’

segments.pli: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
segments.en: That’s how you should train.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, a farmer has three urgent duties.

suttaplex.blurb: Neither a farmer or a mendicant makes their work bear fruit any faster just by wishing for it.
